ResearchProjectDef.label: Civilian Clothing
ResearchProjectDef.description: Design and produce civilian attire reflecting the prosperity and diversity of American society, from business suits to workwear and leisure fashions seen across the nation.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Presidential Suite
ResearchProjectDef.description: Develop formal wear befitting the President of the United States, suitable for state functions, diplomatic meetings, and public addresses in the White House.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Standard Infantry Outfitting
ResearchProjectDef.description: REquip the United States Army with regulation uniforms and gear, ensuring every soldier is prepared for service at home and abroad in defense of American interests.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Infantry Variations
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create specialized uniforms and equipment for Army units, including winter warfare, engineers, and medics, tailored to the diverse needs of the U.S. military.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Marine Corps
ResearchProjectDef.description: Research and develop the equipment and tactics used by the United States Marine Corps, ensuring they are prepared for amphibious and expeditionary warfare.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Mechanized Infantry Regiment
ResearchProjectDef.description: Modernize the U.S. Army with mechanized divisions, integrating power armor to enhance mobility and battlefield dominance.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Officer Corps
ResearchProjectDef.description: Outfit the Officer Corps with distinguished uniforms and advanced equipment, symbolizing leadership and readiness for command in the armed forces.
